basic.floral_language:
Pachyphytum cv.Momobijin 
Floriography: lovely, beautiful, warm.
Pachyphytum is a small genus of succulents in the Crassulaceae family. The name comes from the ancient Greek pachys (thick) and phyton (plant) after the thick leaves. The so called P. 'Blue Haze' or P. cv. MOMOBIJIN is the hybrid of P. bracteosum and P. glutinicaule. This cultivar possesses pink thick oval leaves with white powder covered. It looks prettier from distance with the pink cloth. The shape and arrange of the leaves make the plant look like a blooming Indian lotus from bird eye's view. 
The cultivar requires sunny habitat, turning white or green if it could not receive plenty of sunlight. Small red flowers bloom occasionally.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, blooms sometimes, a long scape sprouts from the plant center, blooms with small red flowers in 5-pointed star shape
basic.color: Leaf color pale pink or light purple

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, no apparent dormancy in summer
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
